website_summaries.verdict: Offers a combination of user-friendly features and some potential longevity issues.
pros: Lightweight yet powerful, as it emits 2200 watts of peak power that's suitable to power your important electrical appliances
Can run as long as 12 hours per tank of fuel
cons: The exception to this model being easy to start and use is the fact that some lemons that stopped working have been reported

customer_reviews.title: Great price for an excellent generator
customer_reviews.text: Excelente generator. Easy, quiet and quick start. Im a resident in Puerto Rico and a Huricane Maria Survivor. I had to bring it from the states and we feel so gratefull for having this super economic generator. I bought 2 and wish I could have purchased more to help my neighbors.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else
customer_reviews.text: It wouldn't even start, I tried everything then the cord broke. I called Westinghouse customer service and they told me they would have a rep call me they couldn't start the process. They sent an email with an open service order. Its been 20 days and no one can help me with a new generator that never started. Read the recent reviews, there are others with the same problem. WESTINGHOUSE HASN'T DONE ANYTHING !! Amazon was great about me finally returning it for a refund. I bought a Wen from Amazon and couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Me no See

customer_reviews.title: Many issues with carburation
customer_reviews.text: After 200-300 hours of use, the generator start to fail. The Spark always black with signal of issue with the combustion. Few days ago, start to fail the generator with a bug in the motor (carbonation issue). My technical open the generator and find a bad assemble from fabric. This bad quality process evidence (see pictures) produced a early issues in the generator.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Greatest investment
customer_reviews.text: This is worth every dollar!! What a life saver.. we took it camping for 8 days only had to recharge once. Blew up mattress no problem, charged phones every night, Just a great product Does not run a blow dryer ladies I tried everyone I have lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: reliable generator !
customer_reviews.text: We live off the grid so I use this generator every day, lots of hours. I change the oil once a week, and have over 1200 hours on it in 8 months. Works great and always starts easily. would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: bigjon

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but noisier than expected
customer_reviews.text: The generator is very high quality, compact and lightweight, and easy to use. A very good value. But - it gets quite noisy under significant load. (If only under light load, it's not too loud. However, the engine really revs up and gets much louder if running an appliance drawing lots of amps. Don't know if this dramatically increasing noise level is also true of the much more expensive Honda and Yamaha generators.) Be careful to check for manufacturer recalls due to risk of fire. That research also influenced me to choose the Westinghouse generator (no recalls in place) rather than the more expensive but perhaps quieter alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Sooo glad we bought these
customer_reviews.text: Last night we had a power outage due to Hurricane Sally. We had just bought two of these generators about a month ago. One for me and one for my husband and so glad we did. They lasted all day. Charged our cell phones and ran our laptops all day (10-12 hours) and we still had one bar left when the power was finally restored to our area. Haven’t tested them with our solar panel yet.
customer_reviews.author: psmadel

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding design, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is evident someone at Westinghouse worked hard to make an affordable but well designed small generator. From the quiet operation to the easy to use carburetor drain to drain the gas out so it can be stored, to the cool swooping look, to supplying exactly the correct amount of oil in the packaging, someone worked hard to get the design just right while selling it for 1/2 the price of the competition! Rare to find a product like this. Just got mine and it started up on the first pull. Highly recommended--and I previously owned the Honda 2000i which was great, but this is even better.
customer_reviews.author: T. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Carry with one hand & it's quiet.
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research, I kept coming back to this one. It started on the 4th pull the first time I tried it. It is quiet. I checked it with a phone app (who knows how accurate, but seems close). It showed 64-66db 15-20 feel away inside a 30' x 40' garage with no load and was the same right by it. You could stand on one side and easily talk to someone on the other side of the generator. I haven't used it for emergency yet, but am confident after initial check that it will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Don-Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for 2 weeks now after Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico. Runs smoothly and its light weight. I can run a fridge, a fan, and a multiple device charger for more than 10 hours with just one gallon of gas. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Modified sine wave = junk AC, choppy wave AC, dirty AC, garbage AC
customer_reviews.text: This is for the FAKE WESTINGHOUSE iGEN160s: I JUST GOT THIS PEACE OF FAKER JUNK TODAY FOR 130 dollars, it does NOT power even a 32 inch led tv it does a weird sound because IT IS MODIFIED SINE WAVE( garbage AC, dirty AC, choppy wave AC) when plug in tv and runs a 120v fan but it makes an ugly noise. STAY AWAY THEY CLEARLY ADVERTISE IT POWERS A 32 inch tv and does NOT please Do NOT buy if you want to use AC devices Because of the junk low quality modified sine wave.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Works great but won't turn off.
customer_reviews.text: The generator works great and as advertised. It is much quieter than non-inverter generators I've owned in the past. Right now my only complaint is the shut down procedure. The owners manual says the procedure is to unplug all devices and turn the engine control / fuel know to the off position. When I turn mine to the off position, the generator keeps humming along with no problem. The way I have to turn it off to to put on full choke and after about 15 seconds it runs out of fuel and turns off. I haven't reached out to Westinghouse yet, but I'll update this review if the problem is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Whimpy
customer_reviews.text: This generator is supposed to supply 15 amps of power at 120 volts. Using a 10 gauge 50' extension cord, it would not power my electric chainsaw, which draws 14.5 amps. It did run quietly, and it wasn't too hard to start. One other negative aspect, though: in order to change the oil or drain the carb, you have to remove a side panel. To do that, you have to unscrew 2 phillips head screws. Then, you have to pry the panel off. This is unnecessarily time consuming. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: jim jim

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT AND SERVES IT’S PURPOSE!
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE*** This is a GREAT INVESTMENT! Really cool and it charges my laptop, phone and camera batteries.! I charge it using solar panel and my car cigarettes lighter port and it gets full most days! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Emores

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality
customer_reviews.text: This generator has been great. Strong and very quiet, not noiseless, but pretty darn quiet. The only issue I have is the dial to turn on the choke and run settings. I wish they were not on the same dial but had different dials for each one. It makes it difficult to find the right position for it to run after being on choke. I also wish it had a fuel shut off so I could clear the fuel lines. Easy to start and runs well.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This ran our refrigerator on its lowest setting for 6 hours. It is important to note that when running a major appliance it does get louder, something that is only implied in the description. But it was easy to prepare and fuel, and ran like a champ. In an emergency we figure 2 gallons during daylight hours to run the refer and charge our devices, then things will stay relatively cool inside until the next morning. We've got 10 gallons on hand, which will do us for 5 days. If that isn't enough...well then we've got bigger problems than a refrigerator.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan

customer_reviews.title: Small portable generator.
customer_reviews.text: This portable generator is a very good choice for light duty use. It is heavy to pick up and carry to your car or truck so park close to it. Also after you break it in you should start it once a month to maintain it's starting capabilities. I waited a couple of months after I broke mine in and starting it was difficult. Since I adopted the once a month starting program the generator has started by the second or third pull of the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Got two, both DOA
customer_reviews.text: Think perhaps they got a bad batch. I tried two of them and they both had the same problem directly out of the box. They would not start. Would start for 2 seconds with a prime, so there was spark, otherwise nothing. Fuel delivery or carb problem. Called the company and they couldn't figure out how to fix anything. They suggested I take my new item to a repair shop. Very dissatisfied with this brand's quality assurance.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: ok but not great.
customer_reviews.text: It was quiet but louder than i wanted. when it’s under load it ramps up and gets a lot louder. It was heavy, but not so heavy i couldn’t move and load it. I had issues with mine shutting off during the night for no obvious reason. It also seemed to sputter. Possibly defective. I sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: reliable back up
customer_reviews.text: We use this as a back up for our housr on Vieques PR. In the past 3 years we have had to use over 16 times. So times for only a few hours but mostly for a day or two. It always starts right up and runs a 2 bed 2 bath house other than the AC. I change the oil evey 30 hours or so and keep the air filter clean. I've changed to plug once. I would recommend to anyone looking for a reliable back up.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie  Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Generator
customer_reviews.text: We needed a generator for our RV Trailer that would provide power while boondocking. We just came back from 7 day boondocking trip and the generator worked flawlessly. Easy to pull start on the first try, quiet, runs for about 5-6 hours on a tank of fuel and powered everything in the trailer. It would not start the 15K AC but we can always add a second unit for summer hot weather. Very happy with the purchase and overall quality of the generator.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and fuel efficient power at fair price
customer_reviews.text: The unit starts easy and runs good. The fuel use is very efficient and noise is very reasonable. Wish it had a fuel petcock to turn off the fuel and run the carburetor dry but it doesn't. You must remove the service panel and drain the fuel bowl manually. Other than that it is a decent power source for small wattage needs. You must go online and register your generator for the warranty. We actually found a service center in our area should a problem occur in the 3 year warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Erik A.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliabile...
customer_reviews.text: issues on the first week of use. Charger stopped working for no reason. Takes forever to charge 8 hours plus 8+ hours of charge will provide max 50wh Definitely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: MarKing

customer_reviews.title: not a lie,  a great little generator.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a Yamaha and Honda generator. Those are great generators but I see NO difference in the quality of components used so am impressed with this generator. For the money you would expect some cheapening up of the build but I don't see any. I've owned mine about 6 months and it has worked really well. The reviews that think these are made cheap haven't bought a Honda or Yamaha in a long while.. LOL. I like the hose and carb bowl drain valve that is suppied. I have always used alcohol free fuel and always have drained the carb bowl when not using the generator.. since it is so easy to do on this generator.
customer_reviews.author: hank

customer_reviews.title: Started First Pull
customer_reviews.text: No problems. Started first pull after adding fuel and oil. Noise level not bad at all. I've only run for an hour so far. I tried it on power saver mode and hooked up a big battery charger for my lawnmower batteries. Didn't even break idle. So far so good. I like the unit and am hoping it will provide service for a good long while. They run/test these units before shipping them to the retailers, so don't be surprised if you smell a little fuel or oil odor upon opening the box. Well packaged. Heavy little sucker.
customer_reviews.author: The Giant

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I had a framed generator before and it was nosey and it would trip the safety in the 110 socket every time! Because it did not have the inverter built in. I felt it was only a matter of time before it fried something in my Rv. This generator gives me clean power. Pros Easy to set up right out of the box Easy to use Started the first day and ever since Con Not as quiet as I thought it was going to be, but can be used at a campground and it will not annoy the other campers.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Doe

customer_reviews.title: Half the price of Honda, same results
customer_reviews.text: I like Honda a lot. Own a Honda vehicle. Common sense says buy a Honda generator right? Wrong. Not placing any judgement of being a fanboy/girl of any brand. To each their own. In my brain, common sense matters. I used this Westinghouse generator for camping and it was very quiet - a PLEASANTRY. Easy to crank and easy to store - this is a no-brainer purchase at at least half the cost of Honda. Go ahead and spend $900-$1000 on the Honda if you wish. Or, use the extra $500 in savings and buy a 400w-500w portable lithium battery station to power essentials (mini-fridge, lights, cellphones, fans, etc) when you can't run the generator.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great generator but get the camo color
customer_reviews.text: Starts right up runs quiet till you put a load on it. 80% load high as I’ve plAced on it. The blue color gets me a few remarks sure wished I would have bought the camo one. It is quite a bit heavier than my Honda wheighs 48 lbs Ran it long enough to use full tank about 4 hrs at 80%
customer_reviews.author: Mac Hohenberger

customer_reviews.title: super easy to set up - ran a couple of fridges and more with ease
customer_reviews.text: does what it is supposed to during a power outage. Started so smoothly and ran nicely. not the easiest to fill since you cannot tell it is full until it is full! and it doesn't have a very long neck to fill into. With only ~1gallon to fill it goes fast from a 5 gallon can above it. I might fill a smaller can next time before pouring gas into it. note: it is not supposed to be in the rain so unless you have a covered location to run this from during a storm you should plan that into your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mgevans

customer_reviews.title: iGen2500
customer_reviews.text: Machine started right up like it should. I done the break-in run period with the generator and have ran it for a few hours so far and I works like it should. This generator will power up everything on my 20' camper with no problem. Just not everything at the same time but know that before I bought this product. Thanks Westinghouse.
customer_reviews.author: Tone

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a nice little unit for backup when power goes out
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good little inverter/generator. Arrived on time. Well packaged. Read all the instructions first, then filled with oil ( provided) and gas. Unit started on 3rd pull. Ran it about 15 minutes then shut it off. Very quiet. Everything was still nice and tight. No leaks. Started it again on 2nd pull and let it run for half an hour then put a small load on. Unit handles 2 refrigerators with no problem. Quality seems good. Have to wait on reliability
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Unit won't run, Westinghouse suggested I take a brand new unit in for local repair. No thanks.
customer_reviews.text: More than $600 for a brand new generator and it won't run. Went through all the troubleshooting with Westinghouse and they suggested i take it to a local repair place. Hard no. I would never trust the unit and I didn't pay $600 to end up with an essentially 'refurbished' unit. Returning and getting something else. UPDATE: I received a replacement unit, and it wouldn't even run a strip of LED rope lights without pegging to 75% load. Complete Joke!!! Less than One star.
customer_reviews.author: TFW

customer_reviews.title: small compact
customer_reviews.text: Got 4 one main reason but will use other features on it. I will use to operate a 12v pump for air mattress. Hope the better will last to pump the mattress and have battery left to use if mattress needs more air during my trip. Other reason is to charge two phones and Bluetooth speaker
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: bought2 of these...  could get neither to start, & westinghouse support was practically non existent
customer_reviews.text: we bought one of these, feeling pretty confident in the westinghouse brand. wouldnt start no matter what we did... we got the authorization to return, bought the exact same kind, it arrived while we were packing up the first, and same thing... would not start. we had tickets into westinghouse, but that was pretty much a lost cause... their support was horrible. we ended up returning both and buying one locally from home depot.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Logue

customer_reviews.title: Even with a semi-powered power I was able to power a movie, TV, light, and glue gun!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Product I like the DC to AC inverter. It also has a Lithium Ion battery the gold standard for electronic battery applications.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Started on first pull!
customer_reviews.text: We spent a lot of time evaluating small generators and this became clearly the best value for a product with the Westinghouse brand. The starting instructions are clear and concise. They make it very easy to get your generator performing! The noise level is low. The unit is a little heavier than expected, but it is still mobile. This is a great looking product with a well organized control panel. I will be buying another one later in the year, as a back up during hurricanes. I will live in Florida, so this is a welcome first line of defense in case we lose power again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Van Butsel

customer_reviews.title: I think I saw a pile of leaves in the junkyard
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't handle loads well.i have an 8,000 btu ac and a fan and light hooked up n it seems to be giving off less than advertised continuous watts ,which is SUPPOSED to be 2200 continuous, it would not flip the breaker if this was correct, because an 8,000 btu a/c takes between 800- 1200 watts upon startup and running, thus there should be 1300 watts of power left for other appliances, and it is false, I may return it and get a HONDA!
customer_reviews.author: FalconPaw

customer_reviews.title: Better then Honda?
customer_reviews.text: Not really but you can't beat the price. This little generator does what it needs to do. Has started up for me every time I needed it. I use it with my RV whenever I don't have enough solar due to clouds or rain. Comes in handy when I need to do some work where no power is readily available. I did look at the Honda but could not justify the cost for the amount of usage it was going to get. All in all, a great little generator.
customer_reviews.author: Tom In GA

customer_reviews.title: Great little generator!  IGEN 2500
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little generator! I ran it last night after opening it up, let it warm up a bit and then put it to the test. I ran 2 TVs; portable camper AC, 3 lights and charged my phone and I was still only at 50% on amperage light up meter. I'm glad I went with this one that has a bit more power than needed for the extra hundred bucks. Now we have a generator to run things if power goes out at the house or when camping. Wish I would have got one of these sooner and it's several hundreds dollars less than Honda. Runs fairly quiet with very easy start. Happy with purchase..
customer_reviews.author: Smartshopper1233

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Start
customer_reviews.text: While the generator performed as expected, I was disappointed it was difficult to start when we were at 8,200' elevation and temperatures in the 60's. It took between 10 and 15 pulls for the unit to start. A new unit should start within two to three pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Joy M.

customer_reviews.title: Fired right up! Arrived timely, Very quiet!  Wow!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a camper we purchased. Arrived timely and didn’t open the package for 3 weeks. Finally got to adding the oil it came with, gasoline. Pulled the starter cord 1/2 way and it fired right up. No exaggeration as I don’t review often. This thing fired right up so easily and was super quiet in conserve mode and normal mode. Ordering another to ensure I can fire up the 15K BTU AC. Can’t wait to use it for dry camping!
customer_reviews.author: 66 pony fastback

customer_reviews.title: Defective Unit Failed out of Box!
customer_reviews.text: The unit failed to start out off the box. Unfortunately I missed the 1 year warranty by about one week and was told to go to Northern Tool who is their designated repair company. Northern will not even diagnose the unit and I am stuck trying to find someone who will - and yes, we are in hurricane season. Westinghouse customer service is of little, if any help. Consequently, I am stuck with a defective from the factory unit. Next time I will by a Honda. I cannot recommend purchasing this product or the Westinghouse customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Ironjohn

customer_reviews.title: Interesting Inverter Story
customer_reviews.text: So i bought this igen2200 twice. The first one I bought...brand new, and would not start or run. so I exchanged it for another brand new igen2200. The second one started on the second pull and runs smooth, quiet and strong. I believe that Westinghouse has a serious QC (quality control) issue and its a matter of buying the right igen2200. Once you find a good QC igen2200, they run great. If you buy one that has poor QC, your gonna have problems
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: It's very quiet. I didn't realize it was on till I plugged my projector on. It also came charged. And super small. Hopefully it will work nicely for my outdoor movie nights. We'll update once actually used.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk, did not work at all. We followed all the instructions we are experienced. And it would not start. Not too much fun to have a worthless generator arrive before a big trip.
customer_reviews.author: A G

customer_reviews.title: A Heads-Up!
customer_reviews.text: Changed oil. Changed spark-plug. Checked oil level. Checked gas level. Nothing works and do not want to work on it as do not want to void warranty. Sending it back. Wish there was an answer somewhere for this sanctioned by Westinghouse. Oh, well. Guess it will be shopping local. Thanks anyway amazon. UPDATE: Needs to be put in manual or elsewhere that there is a fan inside that needs airflow; DO NOT COVER HEAT-DISPLACEMENT FAN FLOW! The engine will not run or start, in my experience. After figuring this out the inverter/generator runs freaking great. I had the exhaust backed up to porch-railing and the intake was blocked by kick-board. Duh.... Will definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: amzusr

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup right out of the box. Used TruFuel and synthetic oil (just to be safe) and it starts up with little effort. The unit will be my emergency generator if SHTF. Tested it against a portable A/C (14,000 BTU) and it started it up with no issues. I could see it running my portable A/C as well as my refrigerator with no issues if I got into a pinch.
customer_reviews.author: zunar_j5

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!!!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! Had Hugh hopes. After the first one wouldn’t even start, I opted for one more shot. Had amazon ship me a new one. This one only ran while on choke, constantly missed and backfired. Knob fell out within 45 seconds of running from the vibration. Very disappointed. Guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: S&D Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great Honda alternative.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a second gen to pair with the Honda when needed, but could not justify the expense of another one (Honda). This WH seems to be virtually as good. It literally started first pull. Seems to as quiet, if not quieter than the Honda but have not had them side by side yet. If it lasts and continues to run as does then it’s a great value generator.
customer_reviews.author: david r

customer_reviews.title: Great generator
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered the 2200 to go with my 2500 so I can run in parallel and run the A.C. On my travel traler. Came in. 1 day and was easy to set up. Added oil and gas and started on second pull. Super quite and runs smooth. The parallel cord is in its way can't wait to try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Bills

customer_reviews.title: Back up power
customer_reviews.text: Got this for backup power. Tested it and works. Will update review once I fully used it. Compact size really impressive. Pictured it beside a water bottle for size perspective.
customer_reviews.author: Shinigami

customer_reviews.title: Solid Generators
customer_reviews.text: So far these have been good generators. They are pretty light and run pretty quietly. What I like best is that they are about the same size and weight of most 2000 watt generators, yet they can produce up to 2500 watts. We have two and the extra power is nice. We have 2 AC units in our trailer and we can run both units when using both generators. I also like the digital gauges. It allows me to be able to see how the generators are doing without having to go all the way to them. It’s nice having a fuel gauge too.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this generator in February as a backup power system for our Nissan Sunrader RV. The iPro2500 starts easily and responds instantly to load. We've tested it with our 1500 watt induction cooktop, and it worked great. It provides a good independent power option for camping with the RV or a car, and we look forward to using it a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Meno

customer_reviews.title: The perfect Gen for Light Duty Power!
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a awesome lil generator, bought this to run a 6000btu A/c window unit for Hurricane Prep. Living on the SE Texas Coast causes you to always be ready. This lil guy is perfect for light duty power and compact enough that the wife and kids can use it if I’m at work. I highly recommend this Generator!
customer_reviews.author: treyh007

customer_reviews.title: no tech support
customer_reviews.text: 1st review ever. 66 yr old with "a little" small engine know how. arrived 9/3 undamaged box. removed and inspected, broken spark plug and fuel cap wouldn't reseal per other reviews. did not waste time fueling or oiling because after 12 phone calls, 4 emails with service ticket no response back from support, 10 working days now. returned. 1 star cuz I like blue and the potential it had. yah I still bought after reading all the 1-3-5 star reviews. guess you gotta know WEN to change,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to take it to a campground, but I set it up, fired it up, attached my trailer and flipped on my 13,500BTU A/C and.....cold air. This is so much quieter than my conventional generator - now I feel like I can run it when I go camping and not be concerned for my safety with the other campers. :-) Very happy. Solid, quiet, well built..
customer_reviews.author: Emily and Jared

customer_reviews.title: High quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have not taken this on a camp trip, but it ran my RV's AC, refrigerator, and lights, all at once. I did not try to microwave something as I didn't want to push my luck. It runs really nice. I was going to buy a Honda but, after reading the reviews, I could not justify the immense price difference. This one is 2500 watts vs. the Honda 2000 watts and it costs a whole lot less. I will pay extra if I am paying for quality. I will not pay extra if I am paying for a name. So far I am impressed but like I said I haven't taken it camping yet and have only tested it out.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Super generator
customer_reviews.text: This generator worked great during the recent hurricane. We lost power for four days and this baby powered a few lamps, a fan, tv, cell phone chargers and our fridge with no problem. It is very easy to start - half a pull will do the trick. It is lightweight enough that you can carry it easily by the handle. The the two best features though are that it is very fuel efficient and quiet. We ran it all day on one tank of gas. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: The best generators.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Westinghouse Inverter Generator. Lately the power is out a lot. We wanted another so we can piggy back them and run many more household appliances. Have owned other brands throughout the years - this is the most reliable and easy to start brand we’ve had. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Seger

customer_reviews.title: Best for price/output
customer_reviews.text: Living in Margarita island, Venezuela, the 2500 IPro is a must. The ratio output/portability is excellent. Work as advertised. Addendum after a few months of use: The pulling cord breaks soon, regardless of careful use. This, usually a simple task, goes complicated because seller doesn't provide an exploded view. Some inner pieces tend to break at finger pressure. A 'delicate' machinery, whose performance doesn't appear to last long.
customer_reviews.author: Inquisitive

customer_reviews.title: Must have if your a primitive RV'er
customer_reviews.text: Bought just to keep camper charged when need be, but si quiet the kids ran it nearly nonstop for the 3 day weekend so they could charge RC cars in the camper, ran over 11 hours on a tank of fuel, RV 4-5 RC chargers and Dewalt charger plugged in for most of that. As far as noise,Father in law (sitting under our awning) didnt even realize it was running about 20 from the other side of the camper.
customer_reviews.author: Bigborgman

customer_reviews.title: kudos to amazon
customer_reviews.text: Had problem with first unit received-would not start. Amazon was fantastic...arranged for a pick-up return and sent me a replacement asap (even though I didn't have the original box) ...second unit started right away and is ready for next power outage/camping ... Unit itself is nice, compact and simple to use. Only reason for 4 star was the no start issue on the first unit.
customer_reviews.author: northern comfort

customer_reviews.title: Solid, started easily on first pull!
customer_reviews.text: Solid, fired right up. I was impressed at how quickly and easily this thing fired up. I added a small hourmeter to better track maintenance. I’m looking forward to seeing if it will run the AC on my camper. even if it does not, the portability and noise level will be useful in many applications for me
customer_reviews.author: mtnlion48

customer_reviews.title: NOT RUNNING CORRECTLY
customer_reviews.text: unit arrived on wed. the 8th . set up today and started , will not run smoothly , runs ruff like constantly going to QUIT , gas was new , nothing in manual that may explain, other than what we tried . because of this also very noisy. contacted WESTING HOUSE , THEY SAID WOULD GET BACK TO US IN 24 TO 48 HRS , WHICH WILL PROBABLY BE MONDAY THE 13TH.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So Easy
customer_reviews.text: This is really easy to use. Started easily and the noise level is amazing, not disturbing at all. I only just used it for a trial run and haven't put it under heavy load as yet. I powered up my freezer and ran it for a couple hours with no hiccups and gas usage was minimal. Really liking it so far! The 5th star will come when I really have to load it up over an extended period
customer_reviews.author: Rumeister

customer_reviews.title: Great Generator
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this generator to power my gas furnace in the case of a ice storm and power outage. It came 2 days after a need to use it. When it came it was easy to set up and get started. I made a clamp on cord for the furnace and tried it. Furnace works and it is ready for another event. Will lone it to our children if they lose power. It is very quiet. Can't wait for camping season.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Better than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to keep on our sailboat as we have not yet purchased a solar package or a large inverter for our boat. Compared this unit against the equvilant Honda which has a slightly larger engine (just a few cc's) but the wattage output on the Westinghouse was higher with a way lower price tag. So far very satisfied as we are able to run the boats battery charger at anchor while supporting all the onboard devices (12 volt fridge draws 9 amps) while simultaneously running an ac tool such as a sander or shopvac.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kuchtyn

customer_reviews.title: A VERY WELL MANUFACTURED, GOOD QUALITY AND HANDY GENERATOR
customer_reviews.text: It’s a compact and well manufactured generator. It’s light and quiet, which makes it very handy for covering power outages at home and also for outdoor activities. I’m a HVAC contractor and eventually I have to work at jobsites without power service. This generator is light enough to carry on to power small electrical tools, including a music device. The power quality it delivers is clean and good so it’s possible to charge portable computers, phones and power on any electronic device without risks. Fuel economy is very good. I have no need to contact customer support, but I can guess it should be fine from a company like Westinghouse.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Engine pulses while not under load.  And Tech Support will not get back to me.
customer_reviews.text: bought this because it seemed like a good product. The generator engine pulses even when it is not under load. I am very disappointed in the technical support. It has been over two weeks and still no contact from them. Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fired Up
customer_reviews.text: Dumped the oil in it, gave it some fuel and it fired up immediately! Would love another to pair up to it, but in the meantime it'll do just fine. I have a little Ridgid 4 gallon vac I hooked up to it and the vacuum is louder than this generator! I didn't think it was possible to be that quiet but it is! Hope that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Aces Mobile Detailing LLC

customer_reviews.title: Westinghouse iGen2200 - The perfect generetor for home
customer_reviews.text: Westinghouse iGen2200 Super Quiet Portable Inverter Generator is the perfect product for your home, very low noise level, easy portability and very good value for money product. The gas consumtion is low and perfect to energizer the most importants equipments at home.
customer_reviews.author: KNS

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it three times camping and starts easily and runs smoothly. It’s still pretty light weight when full of fuel and easy to transport. We have not loaded it up yet so not sure how well it will power a lot of things but time will tell. Will update when we rack up more hours and need an oil change.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Product defective
customer_reviews.text: Defective will not work. returned for replacement or refund and even tho I returned it in original box, packaging and accessorizes Amazon charged me over $100 deducted from my refund. Restocking fee? Shipping? Tax? If this is restocking fee I pity the next customer they ship it to. Have lost all faith in Amazon return policy.
customer_reviews.author: bubbabud

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Works like its suppose to but is a tad noisy it needs a muffler on the back and does have a rattle sound. Unfortunately the pull string just broke on our trip after 1 year 4 months. Other than that it is easily moveable and a good value for the money so far
customer_reviews.author: randi gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Cuts not when switched to run
customer_reviews.text: My generator starts fine but cuts out shortly upon switching from choke to run, even after running for 30 min plus on choke. Based on one of the top negative reviews there seems to be a problem with that dial. Maybe the choke and run markings are switch. I'll test that and report back.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Received iPro2500 on Thursday. Friday AM I put oil and gas in it and it started right up with no problems. I tested it with some tools and it worked great. About a hour and a half later the power went off again. So I went and started the iPro and watched the noon news on the TV and satellite. I'm Happy
customer_reviews.author: Bargainhunter

customer_reviews.title: Great value and highest watt rating of similar generators
customer_reviews.text: Took my iGen2500 generator camping and used it for a few hours. So far everything is working well. I did a few oil changes in the beginning to get rid of the metal flakes from break-in. It isn't as quiet as the Hondas, but it also is rated higher at 2500 starting watts which I think puts it just within the territory of starting some RV AC units.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this inverter! Have never owned one before but purchased this for a mobile car detailing business and it’s very simple to do the initial set up for oil and gas and the size is perfect and easily carried!
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for camping
customer_reviews.text: It starts with one pull. Very quite. Just a hum in eco mode. I completely forgot it was running a couple of times. Not too big or heavy. I used this to recharge battery packs, phone, and to run my laptop off of when camping. Zero issues so far. It lasts about 12 hours to a tank with my limited power use.
customer_reviews.author: B. Young

customer_reviews.title: Good portable quiet generator
customer_reviews.text: The product came with a cracked spark plug and cable/boot - Disappointing but the Westinghouse service in this instance was very quick to replace. Ran to break in for an hour, changed oil, ran again with load and changed oil- highly recommend since it really needs break in cleaning. Noise level very good. Low DB and reasonable DB when load.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kelley (PKC)

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit For The Price
customer_reviews.text: The unit is light, portable and pretty powerful given the 2500 watt peak. I purchased it to cover my fridge, a few fans and LED lights in the event of an extended power outage. I have a camper and intend it to run the AC too, but that will quite a Smart start device. Still, given the weight and power that is not an issue to add this. The only negative is a little dinging sound when running and goes quiet when you pull the started cord out about 2 inches. I do like the build in power load gauges and time left on fuel.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Started up right out of the box. Easy to operate. Good price for the value. We like it's compact size and plan to use it on our boat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work right out of the box. Super Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Fired up out of the box but would never charge anything. Indicator light never came on and overload light flashed when starting it the second time. Returning it. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JLawrence

customer_reviews.title: Broke first use
customer_reviews.text: The generator pull string broke on the second pull out of the box. Appears to be a poor quality. For similar money you can buy a Yamaha that works much better and is built much better. Amazon won't take it back because we didn't open it up and run it when we first received it. So if you do dare order this, make sure you open it up and test it right away or you'll get a DOA generator and no help.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew P.

customer_reviews.title: Great cold weather operation.
customer_reviews.text: Just came back from a 3 day ice fishing trip ran constantly the entire time in -10 to-35 degree temps added some Heet to gas was all the babying done to I would highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: G Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, portable, easy to use, and quiet. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is idea for being able to move it around. Small enough to tote. It does have a little weight especially when full Of gas but not impossible to pick up to load or unload even for a woman with arthritis like myself. I love the easy pull start! It is pretty quiet especially compared to many other types. I used a friends and loved it so much I purchased my own.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Decibel level was quieter than my roof top airconditioner
customer_reviews.text: I fired up both generators today linked them together and powered my travel trailer. I turned the heater on so the A/c would come on and ran the microwave also and had no trouble. they fit great on my cargo carrier on the back of my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: jimbrock50

customer_reviews.title: Very quite without a load
customer_reviews.text: Price was great comparing to Honda Very ez set up Took three pulls to start They provide oil Use the entire bottle. Not mentioned in instructions Comes with a spout Need only phillips screw driver
customer_reviews.author: alex fedosenko

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Quiet, started on first pull, I tested it on my 15000 AC in the rv, ran it no problem.
customer_reviews.author: sgrieser

customer_reviews.title: Great generator
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this generator. Easy start, good controls, and enough wattage to power our items (including the 13,500 btu air conditioner on our camper). Good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: M D M

customer_reviews.title: Small, quiet and well with the price
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, runs for a long time on a tank. Did arrive with a cracked spark plug but I expected that and was prepared with a new one due to other reviews. Does what it is supposed to and does it well.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Beregi

customer_reviews.title: RV 13,500 BTU A/C
customer_reviews.text: The iGen2500 runs my camper RV 13,500 BTU A/C. With nothing else running, all the breakers off, and the engine warmed up the generator would take everything it had to start the A/C before the hard start capacitor was installed in the A/C unit. After the Hard start capacitor (Supco SPP6) was installed in the A/C would start no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This seems loud to me
customer_reviews.text: This seems loud to me especially when you plug anything in and put a load on it. Then it really revs up and the noise level rises noticeably. It is a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: R. W.

customer_reviews.title: would not start right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: unpacked it, filled with oil and gas. no start - no start. as so many others - the spark plug was broken and then after buying a replacement plug- i find the plug wire cap is also broken. sent it back and bought the Honda. what a shame - i had high hopes for this generator and had thought they might have fixed the issues form so many past units with the same problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Vidmar

customer_reviews.title: Would not start
customer_reviews.text: Received the generator, followed start up procedures per the manufactures instructions. After many pulls on the starting rope it never started or attempted to start. Called the Westinghouse tech number and, after waiting on-hold for 45+ minutes the receptionist answered, took my info and said a Service Tech will call me back in a few days. After I got off the phone I logged back into Amazon and arranged a return via Amazon. While I was on Amazon website I ordered a Honda.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Quite!
customer_reviews.text: Was delivered quickly and in great condition. It was very easy to set up and start. The unit runs so quiet you could stand next to it and talk on the phone with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat misleading
customer_reviews.text: The wattage rating seems accurate however, the Amazon picture claims 20A at 120v which is misleading. That works out to be 2400 watts which the generator cannot sustain under load. The sustained maximum load of 2200 watts equates to 18A. Unfortunately, my application needs above 18A. Save some money. Get a lower power rated machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: First time owning a Generator. Bought 2 of these to run camping equipment and future camper A/C. Super easy set up. Oil in. Gas in. Set the choke. One pull and it fired right up!!! ran a few things around the shop to see how it would handle. Box fan no problem. Right angle grinder made it jump up in speed but not a problem. Shop vac and a right angle grinder still no problem. So far im pretty stoked.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Generator was either used and returned or Westinghouse needs to a better job of assuring all gas is properly drained before selling the product as new. It had gummed up gas in the tank and oil in the engine. Carb had to be removed and cleaned before it would run, an hour of disassembly/reassembly. Don't expect these to run right out of the box. That being said, the generator is quiet at low idle but surprisingly loud at when loaded at 1/3 capacity or more. It did start and run a RV 13.5k air conditioner.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: It’s good.
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to start and quiet. It powered two household refrigerators for 9 hours in one tank of gas. I did it for 2 days in a row to break in the engine and changed the oil. Now, I am ready for the hurricane season.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

product_meta.title: Westinghouse iGen2200 Portable Inverter Generator 1800 Rated & 2200 Peak Watts, Gas Powered, CARB Compliant
product_meta.description: Style:iGen2200The Westinghouse iGen2200 Portable Inverter Generator produces 2, 200 peak watts and 1, 800 running watts, making it perfect as an emergency backup for home use or for recreational use. The iGen2200 can simultaneously power most refrigerators and large appliances as well as any home necessities you may need while traveling. Powered by a 4-Stroke OHV Westinghouse engine, the iGen2200 is engineered to automatically adjust its engine speed to produce only the amount of power needed for enhanced fuel efficiency. It’s lightweight and convenient, weighing 46 lbs. with a built-in carrying handle for easy portability. The iGen2200 has an ultra-low tone for community-friendly use, operating as low as 52 dBA which is quieter than the average conversation. Unlike traditional generators, the iGen2200 safely powers sensitive electronics like plasma/LCD televisions, laptops, tablets, and mobile devices by producing clean, stable power at less than 3% THD. If you need more power, the iGen2200 is parallel capable and can be paired with another Westinghouse Inverter Generator using the Westinghouse WHPC Parallel Cord (sold separately). The iGen2200 has built-in safety features including low oil shutdown and overload protection while backed by 3-year limited service, labor, and parts coverage with lifetime technical support.
feature_bullets: 1800 Rated Watts and 2200 Peak Watts at Less Than 3% THD - Weighs Only 46 Lbs. - Gas Powered - Two 120V 20 Amp Outlets, Two USB Outlets
Great Choice for Home Use as an Emergency Backup in a Power Outage - Strong Enough to Run All Your Home Essentials
Extremely Quiet, Extremely Fuel Efficient: as Low as 52 dBA Noise Output and 12 Hour Run Time on a 1. 2 Gallon Gas Tank - Features "Economy Mode" for Maximum Fuel Efficiency
Parallel Capable - Combine Your iGen2200 with the Westinghouse WH2200iXLT, iGen1200, iGen2200, and iGen2500 to Increase Available Wattage and Amperage (Requires Westinghouse Parallel Cord)

All Westinghouse Portable Generators are Functionally Tested in the Factory and May Contain Minimum Residual Oil and/or Fuel Odor; EPA, USFS, and CARB Compliant; Backed by 3-Year Limited Service, Labor, and Parts Coverage with Nationwide Customer Service and Support Network at 1-855-944-3571 or service@wpowereq.com

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,103 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
